Title: VM - Purge Voter

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing Voter
Access the EMS system\n
Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search
Use the search criteria to search for that voter
Click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Click "Purge"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A pop-up box will display asking the user if they want to Purge the Voter

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Cancel"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The pop-up box will close and the Voter is not Purged

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis again
Click "View"
Scroll down to the bottom of the page
Click "Purge"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A pop-up box will display asking the user if they want to Purge the Voter\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Ok"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success notification will be displayed and the user is taken back to the Search Voter page

Test Steps.Step Action: Use the search criteria to search for that Voter again

Title: 77170 - VM - Edit Voter - Unable to edit any voter

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing Voter\n
Access the EMS system\n
Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Use the search criteria to search for that voter\n
Click on the "Actions" ellipsis\n
Click "Edit"
Make no changes to the voter
Scroll down to the bottom and click "NEXT"
Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected: There are no changes between Voter Details and Updated Voter Details

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a Change Reason and click "UPDATE REGISTRATION"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and the user is taken to the Final Screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected: No changes have been made to the Voter's details

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Use the search criteria to search for that same voter\n
Click on the "Actions" ellipsis\n
Click "Edit"\n
Make any desired changes to the voter\n
Scroll down to the bottom and click "NEXT"\n
Check page\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The changes you made will be reflected on this page and highlighted in green (Only certain main fields are on this page so not all changes will be visible here e.g. Phone Number)

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a Change Reason and click "UPDATE REGISTRATION"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success notification is displayed and the user is taken to the Final Screen\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The changes you made will be reflected on this page (Only certain main fields are on this page so not all changes will be visible here e.g. Phone Number)\n

Title: 72373 - VM - Single Scan - Wireframe

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing Voter\n
Access the EMS system\n
Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Use the search criteria to search for that voter\n
Click on the "Actions" ellipsis\n
Click "Scan And Print"
Click "Scan"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Single Scan page is displayed and the user will get a pop-up box asking them to download a driver if they haven't already

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Download"
Install the Driver
Click on the link within the pop-up box to verify the installed driver
Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The following fields will be present:
- Document Name 
- Document Type
- Voter ID
- Selection Source
- Start New Scan (Button)
- Load Local File (Button)
- Indexed
- Delete (Button)
- Upload Indexed (Button)
- Create Crop Copy (Signature) (Tick box)
- Cropping Tools
- Save Crop (Original) (Button)
- Save Crop (Signature)

Test Steps.Step Action: Check this page on different screen sizes and browsers\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The screen/UI looks good and fits on various screen sizes and browsers without issues\n

Title: 69476 - VM - Voter's Preferred Language Selection

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter Search page will be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search" and then click "Add"
Fill in all required fields
Under the Voter Details section click on the "Preferred Language" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The dropdown will open with the following options (Possibility of more options in the future):- English
- Spanish
- Vietnamese
- Mandarin

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a Preferred Language
Scroll down and click "Next"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Review Screen will be displayed and the Preferred Language will be shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Scroll down and click "Register Voter"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Final Screen is displayed and the Preferred Language will be shown here too

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter Search page will be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Use the search criteria to find the voter you just created
Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Voter
Click "View"
Test Steps.Step Expected: View Voter Registration page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected: Preferred Language will be shown here

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter Search page will be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Use the search criteria to find the same voter\n
Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Voter\n
Click "Edit"
Under the Voter Details section select a different Preferred Language
Scroll down and click "Next"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Review Screen is displayed and the updated Preferred Language is shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Scroll down and click "Register Voter"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Final Screen is displayed and the updated Preferred Language will be shown here too\n

Title: 69301 - VM - Participation - Voter Participation Add/Maintain

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisites:\n- Have an existing Active Voter
Access the EMS system\n
Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Use the search criteria to find your existing Voter
Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the existing voter
Click "View"
Click on the "Participation History" tab
Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The Add Participation page is displayed and the following fields are present in this order:

 - Election Date (required field)

 - Election Name (Required field)

 - Party (Primary Only)

 - Method of Request (required dropdown: choices to be Election Day, Absentee, UOCAVA, Vote Center)

 - Request Location (required dropdown: dependent on Method of Request like a specific polling location)

 - Ballot Sent Date (Required)

 - Ballot Received Date (Required)

 - Ballot Return Method (Required dropdown, dependent on method of request)

 - Ballot Status (Required)

 - Ballot Status Reason (required, dropdown dependent on Ballot Status)

 - Checkbox for "Provisional" ballot (optional)

 - If Provisional is checked then the below should display
*Provisional Status (Required)
*Provisional Status Reason (Optional)

 - Comments text box

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "CANCEL"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user is taken back to the Participation History list and the record is not created

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Add Participation page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "CREATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will not be created and all required fields will show as red

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all required fields
Click "CREATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will be successfully created and the user is taken back to the Participation History list where they can see the new record they just created

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Participation History record you created
Click "Edit"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Maintain Participation History page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Make any desired change and click "UPDATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will be updated successfully and you will be able to see the changes reflected in the Participation History list

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Participation History record you just updated\n
Click "Delete"
Click "Cancel"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will not be deleted

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis again\n
Click "Delete"\n
Click "Ok"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will be deleted successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: In the navigation tabs click on "Audit History"
Test Steps.Step Expected:
All Participation History actions will be displayed here:
- Add
- Update
- Delete

Title: 75350 - VM - Voter Registration - Business Rules for Business Address provided as the Residential Address

Test Steps.Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
- Have an existing Street Segment
- Have an existing Business Address
Access the EMS system\n
Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Click SEARCH and then click ADD
Scroll down to Residential Address and search for the street segment that the Business Address is on
Select the street segment and then click SELECT
In the "Street No." fields enter a street number that is outside the business address range
Click SUBMIT
In the "Street No." fields enter a street number that is inside the business address range\n
Click SUBMIT\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The address will not be submitted and a message will display to the user stating that business addresses are not acceptable

Title: 69396 - VM - View Voter - Order of Tabs and add a New Tab for Notes

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Click SEARCH and then click ADD\n
Fill in all required fields
Click NEXT
Scroll down to the bottom
In the "Note" field enter any text e.g. "Test Note"
Click REGISTER VOTER
Test Steps.Step Expected: Final screen is displayed and Voter has been created

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Use the search criteria to find the voter you just created
Next to the voter click the Actions ellipsis
Click "View"
Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The navigation tabs will be displayed in the following order:
- Voter Information
- Absentee Ballots
- Participation
- Petition
- Correspondence
- Audit History
- Notes
- Voter Documents

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Notes tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: Maintain Notes History page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The note you made during voter registration will be displayed here

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Use the search criteria to find the voter you just created\n
Next to the voter click the Actions ellipsis\n
Click "Update"
Make any desired changes and click NEXT
Scroll down to the bottom\n
In the "Note" field enter any text e.g. "Test Note"\n
Choose a Change Reason and click UPDATE REGISTRATION
Test Steps.Step Expected: Final screen is displayed and Voter has been updated

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Use the search criteria to find the voter you just created\n
Next to the voter click the Actions ellipsis\n
Click "View"\n
Click on the Notes tab\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Maintain Notes History page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The note you made while updating the voter will be displayed here \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Check listing of notes
Test Steps.Step Expected: The notes will be listed by time of creation (newest to oldest)

Title: VM - Voter Registration - Signature/No Signature button displays

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to 'Voter Registration': VM > Search > Search > Click 'Add'
Complete the registration of a new voter
Navigate back to voter search: VM > Search
Search for the voter that was just created
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter appears in the search results

Test Steps.Step Action: Click 'Actions' > 'Update'
Test Steps.Step Expected: Land on 'Update Voter' page\nGrayed out 'No Signature on File' button is displayed below voter details

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate back to voter search, and search for the same voter
Click 'Actions' > 'View'
Scroll down and click 'Scan/print'

Upload or Scan a file
Use the crop tool to crop a signature
Click 'Save Cropped Signature'
Select the cropped signature in the index
Click 'Upload Documents'
Test Steps.Step Expected: Signature is applied to the voter

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate back to voter search, and search the same voter: VM > Search > Voter\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter appears in the search results.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click 'Actions' > 'Update'\n
Test Steps.Step Expected:
Land on 'Update Voter' page
'View Signature' appears below voter details
'No Signature on File' button no longer appears below voter details

Test Steps.Step Action: Click 'View Signature' button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Signature Modal/popup appears and displays the voter signature

Title: VM - Display Voter's Polling Location in Registration flow

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter registration\nVM > Search > Click 'Search'> Click 'Add'
Fill all mandatory fields, then assign a valid address that has a valid precinct/polling place
Test Steps.Step Expected: After submitting address 'Polling Place' field  appears  in 'Voting Details' area, displaying the appropriate polling place for the precinct the address is tied to.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click 'Next'
Test Steps.Step Expected: Land on 'Review' screen\n'Polling Place' field appears in 'Precinct Details Review' area, displaying the appropriate polling place for the precinct the address is tied to.

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill out any mandatory fields, and click 'Register Voter'
Test Steps.Step Expected: Land on ''Final' screen\nPolling place appears and displays the correct Polling place for the address previously submitted

Title: Verify that the State ID field remains active and required when "Drivers License/ State ID" is selected from ID Type dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Given User is on the Voter registration page and select "Drivers License/ State ID" from ID Type dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should remain active and required with validation active.

Title: Verify that the State ID field is deactivated when "US Military ID" is selected from ID Type dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the Voter Registration page and select "US Military ID" from ID Type dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should become greyed-out or disabled and should no longer be required.

Title: Verify that the State ID field is deactivated when "US Passport" is selected from ID Type dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the voter registration page and selects "US Passport" from ID Type dropdown.
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should become greyed-out or disabled and should no longer be required.

Title: Verify that the State ID field is deactivated when "Bank Statement" is selected from ID Type dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the voter registration page and select "Bank Statement" from ID Type dropdown.
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should become greyed-out or disabled and should no longer be required.

Title: Verify that the State ID field is deactivated when "Utility Bill" is selected from ID Type dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the voter registration page and select "Utility Bill" from ID Type dropdown.
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should become greyed-out or disabled and should no longer be required.

Title: Verify that the State ID field is deactivated when "Election ID Card" is selected from ID Type dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the voter registration page and select "Election ID Card" from ID Type dropdown.
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should become greyed-out or disabled and should no longer be required.

Title: Verify that the State ID field reactivates when "Drivers License" is selected after selecting another ID type

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the voter registration page and select "US Military ID" from ID Type dropdown and change selection to "Drivers License".
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should become active and required with validation active.

Title: Verify that the State ID field reactivates when "State ID" is selected after selecting another ID type

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the voter registration page and select "US Passport" from ID Type dropdown and change selection to "State ID".
Test Steps.Step Expected: State ID field should become active and required with validation active.

Title: Verify that the ID type selection is stored correctly in voter records and reports

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is on the voter registration page and select any ID type (e.g., "Drivers License") and submit form.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected ID type should be correctly stored in voter records and reflected in reports.

Title: VM - Healthcare Facility Address Indicator

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-Test Data: You will need to locate or enter a 'Special Address' that is setup as a 'Health Care Facility'. This is done through the 'Special Address' screen within District Management.
\n Navigate to 'Voter Registration'\n Voter Management > Search > 'Add'
Scroll down to 'Residential Address' and enter the HCF street in the 'Search Street Name' field. Click 'Search'\n\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search modal appears with correct results

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the street from the list within the modal, and click 'Select'
Enter a valid Low-Hi address number for the HCF in the 'Street No' field. Click 'Submit'
Test Steps.Step Expected: The address is accepted, and 'Healthcare Facility (HCF)' Is displayed in red text beneath the 'City' field.

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill all other mandatory fields on the page, then click 'Next'\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Land on 'Review Screen'\nHealthcare Facility (HCF)'  appears in red to the right of the residential address field.

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill all mandatory fields on the page and click 'Register Voter'
Test Steps.Step Expected: Land on 'Final Screen'\n'Healthcare Facility (HCF)'  is displayed in red text in  below the "address" field

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the ' View Voter Registration' Screen\nVoter Management > Voter Search > Search for the voter that added in the last step.
Test Steps.Step Expected: 'Healthcare Facility (HCF)' is displayed beneath the 'Residential Address' field.

Test Steps.Step Expected: Party Affliation field must be displayed accurately\nNote:This field must be displayed only for QA_Base and IOWA should not be displayed in Texas QA

Title: VM- Verify Date of Last Voter Initiated Activity field-Transfer Voter -County Clerk

Select a change reason as "County Clerk" and "Update Registration"

Title: EMS - VM - Voter Search

Test Steps.Step Action: Open the application and login as county user and navigate to VM Module
Click on the Voter button
Select the search context: State or County from the County or State Search Selector dropdown.
Test Steps.Step Expected: User can select State or County. If State is selected, the search queries the entire state; if County is selected, it filters by county.

Test Steps.Step Action:
Fill in one or more search fields: 
 - Last Name 
 - First Name 
 - Date of Birth 
 - Driver's License/State ID 
 - SSN 
 - Street No. 
 - Street Name 
 - Apt/Unit No. 
 - City 
 - Zip Code 
 - Voter Status
Test Steps.Step Expected: Fields are filled with appropriate search criteria.

Test Steps.Step Action: Optionally, use wildcard search in any of the fields (e.g., %Jones, Jo%, %DES%).
Test Steps.Step Expected: Wildcard characters are used and partial matches are expected (e.g., %Jones returns "Jones," "Johnson").

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Search button.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system processes the search query and displays results based on the entered search criteria.

Test Steps.Step Action: Review the search results displayed in the results grid.
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The following details should be displayed for each voter: 
 - Last Name 
 - First Name 
 - Date of Birth 
 - Street Name 
 - City 
 - Zip Code 
 - Voter Status 
 - County (when logged in as a Region user) 
 - Precinct

Test Steps.Step Action: If search results are paginated, use the pagination controls to navigate between pages (e.g., Next, Previous).
Test Steps.Step Expected: Pagination should work, allowing users to navigate through multiple pages of search results.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the Manage option in the Actions menu next to any voter.
Test Steps.Step Expected: Clicking Manage opens the voter details screen for viewing voter information.

Test Steps.Step Action: Optionally, click Reset to clear all search fields.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search form should reset, clearing all previously entered search criteria.
